channel.description:

Turns out, he's just trying to jump me and take off with my shit lmao. He has no physical evidence that I sell other than these messages.. [b][u]facebook messages[/u][/b]

item.title: Text messages - legal issue?
item.dc:creator: @thiefmn6092 thiefmn6092
item.description:
@thiefmn6092 wrote:

as said previously, i would not worry about getting in trouble for the messages themselves. just do not get lured into meeting him with the product anywhere on you (including your vehicle). here’s an idea,

if you know you are going to be selling to him, tell him the location an hour before you do it and already be there. hide the product somewhere before hand so even if he does try to get you into trouble, you do not actually have it on you - it’s secured somewhere else. if the police do show up, let them do what they will and just get it the next day. this would also help if he tries to threaten you physically and steal it from you.

as for facebook, it is possible for them to receive a subpoena for chat records from your DA. it happens often in the US. keep any confidential communications off of facebook.
